features.name: Sorcerer Proficiencies
features.desc: Sorcerers are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}. They are not proficient with any type of armor or shield. Armor interferes with a sorcerer's gestures, which can cause her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with somatic components to fail.

features.name: Cantrips
features.desc: Sorcerers can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.

features.name: Bloodline
features.desc:
Each sorcerer has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, an additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}, and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family's past. For example, a sorcerer might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the sorcerer gains levels. A sorcerer must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of sorcerer. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
Filled with magical power that screams for release, sorcery is not so much a calling as a blessing — or a curse. For some sorcerers, this arcane birthright manifests in subtle and carefully controlled ways, assisting in their manipulation of others or the pursuit of lofty goals. For others, it is wild and unpredictable, the primal and explosive lashing out of a power greater than themselves.
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional spell, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels. These spells cannot be exchanged for different spells at higher levels.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, a sorcerer receives one bonus feat, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The sorcerer must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.

features.name: Sorcerer Bonus Feat
features.desc: At 1st level, a sorcerer gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. At each such opportunity, she can choose a metamagic feat, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} focus feat, or any other spellcaster feat. The sorcerer must still meet all prerequisites for a bonus feat, including {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} minimums.

features.name: Bloodline Feat Selection
features.desc: At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, a sorcerer receives one bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The sorcerer must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.

features.name: Celestial Bloodline Arcana
features.desc: Whenever you cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} of the summoning subschool, the creatures summoned gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}/evil equal to 1/2 your sorcerer level (minimum 1). This does not stack with any DR the creature might have.

features.name: Celestial Bloodline
features.desc:
Your bloodline is blessed by a celestial power, either from a celestial ancestor or through divine intervention. Although this power drives you along the path of good, your fate (and {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}) is your own to determine. Your celestial heritage grants you a great many powers, but they come at a price. The lords of the higher planes are watching you and your {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} closely.
{g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}Bonus{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Celestial Bloodline: Dodge, Extend Spell, Iron Will, Agile {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}Maneuvers{/g}, Augment Summoning, Superior Summoning, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}Skill{/g} Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g}), Weapon Finesse.

features.name: Heavenly Fire
features.desc: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash a ray of heavenly fire as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Against evil creatures, this ray deals ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This damage is divine and not subject to {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} or immunity. This ray {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} good creatures of (1d4 + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess) points of damage. A good creature cannot benefit from your heavenly fire more than once per day. Neutral creatures are neither harmed nor healed by this effect. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (or {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier for Empyreal Sorcerer).

features.name: Celestial Bloodline Arcana
features.desc: Whenever you cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} of the summoning subschool, the creatures summoned gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}/evil equal to 1/2 your sorcerer level (minimum 1). This does not stack with any DR the creature might have.

features.name: Class Skill — Lore (Religion)
features.desc: Additional class skill from the celestial bloodline.

features.name: Celestial Resistances
features.desc: At 3rd level, you gain resist acid 5 and resist cold 5. At 9th level, your resistances increase to 10.

features.name: Bless
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Bless: This spell fills your allies with courage. Each ally gains a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
Bless dispels bane.

features.name: Resist Energy
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Resist Energy: This abjuration grants a creature limited protection from {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of whichever one of five energy types you select: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. The subject gains resist energy 10 against the energy type chosen, meaning that each time the creature is subjected to such damage (whether from a natural or magical source), that damage is reduced by 10 points before being applied to the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}. The value of the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} granted increases to 20 points at 7th level and to a maximum of 30 points at 11th level. The spell protects the recipient's equipment as well.

features.name: Protection from Energy
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Protection from Energy: This spell grants temporary immunity to the type of energy you specify when you cast it (acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic). When the spell absorbs 12 points per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} (to a maximum of 120 points at 10th level), it is discharged.

features.name: Aura of Heaven
features.desc: At 9th level, you can apply an aura of heaven on yourself for a minute. This aura provides a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by evil creatures to all allies within 20 feet. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to your sorcerer level.

features.name: Remove Curse
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Remove Curse: This spell can remove all curses on an object or a creature. If the target is a creature, you must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) against the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of each curse affecting the target. Success means that the curse is removed.

features.name: Flame Strike
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Flame Strike: A flame strike evokes a vertical column of divine fire. The spell deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, but the other half results directly from divine power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by resistance to fire-based {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.

features.name: Dispel Magic, Greater
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dispel Magic, Greater: This functions as a targeted dispel magic, but it can dispel multiple spells, starting with the highest level spells and proceeding to lower level spells.

features.name: Banishment
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Banishment: This spell is a more powerful version of the dismissal spell. It enables you to force extraplanar creatures out of your home plane. As many as 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} of creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} can be banished in a 30-foot radius; creatures who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first.

features.name: Conviction
features.desc: At 15th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} against evil {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and spells cast by evil creatures equal to 11 + your sorcerer level.

features.name: Wings
features.desc: You gain a pair of wings that grant a +3 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} and an immunity to ground based effects, such as difficult terrain.

features.name: Sunburst
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Sunburst: This spell causes a globe of searing radiance to explode silently from a point you select. All creatures in the globe are blinded and take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}6d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} negates the blindness and reduces the damage by half.
An undead creature caught within the globe takes 1d6 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 25d6), or half damage with a successful Reflex save.

features.name: Summon Monster IX
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Monster IX: This spell summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar movanic devas if you are good or neutral and 1d3 extraplanar frost giants if you are evil, 1d4+1 rocs, or one ghaele azata if you are good or neutral and one thanadaemon if you are evil. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Ascension
features.desc: At 20th level, you become infused with the power of the heavens. You gain immunity to acid, cold, and petrification, resist electricity 10, resist fire 10, and a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against poison.

features.name: Empyreal Bloodline
features.desc: Your heavenly power derives from insight rather than force of personality.

features.name: Heavenly Fire
features.desc: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash a ray of heavenly fire as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Against evil creatures, this ray deals ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This damage is divine and not subject to {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} or immunity. This ray {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} good creatures of (1d4 + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess) points of damage. A good creature cannot benefit from your heavenly fire more than once per day. Neutral creatures are neither harmed nor healed by this effect. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (or {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier for Empyreal Sorcerer).

features.name: Bloodline Arcana
features.desc: Unlike most sorcerers whose innate magic is powered by force of personality, you use pure willpower to master and fuel your magic. You use your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, rather than your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, to determine all class features and effects relating to your sorcerer class, such as bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day, maximum spell level you can cast, and the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of your spells. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.

features.name: Class Skill — Lore (Religion)
features.desc: Additional class skill from the celestial bloodline.

features.name: Celestial Resistances
features.desc: At 3rd level, you gain resist acid 5 and resist cold 5. At 9th level, your resistances increase to 10.

features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Bless: This spell fills your allies with courage. Each ally gains a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
Bless dispels bane.

features.desc:

The subject gains resist energy 10 against the energy type chosen, meaning that each time the creature is subjected to such damage (whether from a natural or magical source), that damage is reduced by 10 points before being applied to the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}. The spell protects the recipient's equipment as well.

features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Protection from Energy: This spell grants temporary immunity to the type of energy you specify when you cast it (acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic). When the spell absorbs 12 points per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} (to a maximum of 120 points at 10th level), it is discharged.

features.name: Channel Positive Energy
features.desc:
At 9th level, your bloodline makes you a natural receptacle of divine energy. You can channel energy once per day. This energy can be used to cause or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, depending on the creatures targeted.
A sorcerer channels positive energy and can choose to deal damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures.
Channeling positive energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the sorcerer. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of damage at 9th level plus 1d6 points of damage for every two sorcerer levels beyond 9th (4d6 at 11th, 5d6 at 13th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the sorcerer's level + the sorcerer's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum hit point total—all excess healing is lost.
This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.

features.name: Remove Curse
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Remove Curse: This spell can remove all curses on an object or a creature. If the target is a creature, you must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) against the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of each curse affecting the target. Success means that the curse is removed.

features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Flame Strike: A flame strike evokes a vertical column of divine fire. Sunburst: This spell causes a globe of searing radiance to explode silently from a point you select. All creatures in the globe are blinded and take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}6d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} negates the blindness and reduces the damage by half.
An undead creature caught within the globe takes 1d6 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 25d6), or half damage with a successful Reflex save.

features.desc:

Summon Monster IX: This spell summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar movanic devas if you are good or neutral and 1d3 extraplanar frost giants if you are evil, 1d4+1 rocs, or one ghaele azata if you are good or neutral and one thanadaemon if you are evil. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Ascension
features.desc: At 20th level, you become infused with the power of the heavens. You gain immunity to acid, cold, and petrification, resist electricity 10, resist fire 10, and a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against poison.

features.name: Abyssal Bloodline
features.desc:
Generations ago, a demon spread its filth into your heritage. While it does not manifest in all of your kin, for you it is particularly {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strong{/g}. You might sometimes have urges to chaos or evil, but your destiny (and {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}) is up to you. While some would say that you are possessed, you know better. The demonic influence in your blood grows as you gain power.
{g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}Bonus{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Abyssal Bloodline: Augment Summoning, Bull Rush, Cleave, Empower {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g}, Great Fortitude, Power {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attack{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}Skill{/g} Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g}), Sunder Armor.

features.name: Grow Claws
features.desc: At 1st level, you can grow claws as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. These claws are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}, allowing you to make two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} as a full attack using your full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. These attacks deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each (1d3 if you are Small) plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier. At 5th level, these claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}. At 7th level, the damage increases by one step to 1d6 points of damage (1d4 if you are Small). At 11th level, these claws become flaming weapons, each dealing an additional 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a successful hit. You can use your claws for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.

features.name: Abyssal Bloodline Arcana
features.desc: Whenever you cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} of the summoning subschool, the creatures summoned gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}/good equal to half your sorcerer level (minimum 1). This does not stack with any DR the creature might have.

features.name: Class Skill — Athletics
features.desc: Additional class skill from the Abyssal bloodline.

features.name: Demon Resistances
features.desc: At 3rd level, you gain resist electricity 5 and a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} made against poison. At 9th level, your resistance to electricity increases to 10 and your bonus on poison saving throws increases to +4.

features.name: Cause Fear
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Cause Fear: The affected creature becomes frightened. If the subject succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, it is instead shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures with 6 or more HD are immune to this effect. Cause fear dispels remove fear.

features.name: Bull's Strength
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Bull's Strength: The subject becomes stronger. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} for 5 minutes, adding the usual benefits to {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and other uses of the Strength modifier. Enhancement bonuses do not stack with other enhancement bonuses, for example with bonuses from belts.

features.name: Rage
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Rage: Each affected creature gains a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +1 morale bonus on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The effect is otherwise identical with a barbarian's rage except that the subjects aren't fatigued at the end of the rage.

features.name: Strength of the Abyss
features.desc: At 9th level, you gain a +2 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}. This bonus increases to +4 at 13th level, and to +6 at 17th level.

features.name: Stoneskin
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Stoneskin: The warded creature gains resistance to blows, cuts, stabs, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashes{/g}. The subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/adamantine. It ignores the first 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each time it takes damage from a weapon, though an adamantine weapon overcomes the damage reduction. Once the spell has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 150 points), it is discharged.

features.name: Dismissal
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dismissal: This spell forces an extraplanar creature back to its proper plane if it fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}.

features.name: Transformation
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Transformation: You become a fighting machine – stronger, tougher, faster, and more {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skilled{/g} in combat. Your mindset changes so that you relish combat and you can't cast spells, even from magic items.
You gain a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +5 competence bonus on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and proficiency with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}. Your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} equals your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} (but not higher than 20), which may give you multiple {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.

features.name: Summon Monster VII
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Monster VII: This spell summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar axiomites if you are good or neutral and 1d3 extraplanar soul eaters if you are evil, 1d4+1 extraplanar bralani azatas if you are good or neutral and 1d4+1 extraplanar redcaps if you are evil, or one roc. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Added Summonings
features.desc: At 15th level, whenever you cast a summoning {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that conjures more than one creature, add one to the total number of creatures summoned.

features.name: Wings
features.desc: You gain a pair of wings that grant a +3 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} and an immunity to ground based effects, such as difficult terrain.

features.name: Unholy Aura
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Unholy Aura: A malevolent darkness surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by good creatures, and weakening good creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}. Unlike the effect of protection from good, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by good creatures.
Second, each warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against good spells and spells cast by good creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects the recipient from possession and mental influence, just as protection from good does.
Finally, if a good creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a warded creature, the offending attacker takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (Fortitude negates).

features.name: Summon Monster IX
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Monster IX: This spell summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar movanic devas if you are good or neutral and 1d3 extraplanar frost giants if you are evil, 1d4+1 rocs, or one ghaele azata if you are good or neutral and one thanadaemon if you are evil. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Demonic Might
features.desc: At 20th level, the power of the Abyss flows through you. You gain immunity to electricity and poison. You also gain resistance to acid 10, cold 10, and fire 10.

features.name: Fey Bloodline
features.desc:
The capricious nature of the fey runs in your family due to some intermingling of fey blood or magic. You are more emotional than most, prone to bouts of joy and rage. You have always had a tie to the natural world, and as your power increases, so does the influence of the fey over your magic.
{g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}Bonus{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Fey Bloodline: Dodge, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Lightning Reflexes, Agile {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}Maneuvers{/g}, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Quicken {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}Skill{/g} Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g}).

features.name: Laughing Touch
features.desc: At 1st level, you can cause a creature to burst out laughing for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. A laughing creature can only take a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} but can defend itself normally. Once a creature has been affected by laughing touch, it is immune to its effects for 24 hours. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. This is a mind-affecting effect.

features.name: Fey Bloodline Arcana
features.desc: Whenever you cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} of the compulsion subschool, increase the spell's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by +2.

features.name: Class Skill — Lore (Nature)
features.desc: Additional class skill from the fey bloodline.

features.name: Woodland Stride
features.desc: At 3rd level, you can move through any sort difficult terrain at your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and without taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} or suffering any other impairment.

features.name: Entangle
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Entangle: This spell causes tall grass, weeds, and other plants to wrap around creatures in the area of effect or those that enter the area. Creatures that fail their {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} gain the entangled condition for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
The entire area of effect is considered difficult terrain while the effect lasts.

features.name: Hideous Laughter
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hideous Laughter: This spell afflicts the subject with uncontrollable laughter. It collapses into gales of manic laughter, falling prone. The subject can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} while laughing, but is not considered {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}. After the spell ends, it can act normally. On the creature's next turn, it may attempt a new {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} to end the effect. A creature with an {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} score of 2 or lower is not affected.

features.name: Deep Slumber
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Deep Slumber: This spell causes a magical slumber to come upon 10 HD of creatures; those who are closest to the spell's point of origin are affected first. HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted. Sleeping creatures are {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}. Slapping or wounding awakens an affected creature, but normal noise does not. This spell does not target {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} creatures, constructs, or undead creatures.

features.name: Fleeting Glance
features.desc:
At 9th level, you can turn invisible for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your sorcerer level. This ability functions as greater invisibility. These rounds need not be consecutive.
Greater Invisibility: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like invisibility, except that it doesn't end if the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
Invisibility: The creature becomes invisible. If a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required, an invisible creature has a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. The spell ends if the subject attacks any creature. For purposes of this spell, an attack includes any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Target}spell targeting{/g} a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. Exactly who is a foe depends on the invisible character's {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}perceptions{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}Actions{/g} directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.

features.name: Poison
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Poison: Calling upon the venomous powers of natural predators, you infect the subject with a horrible poison by making a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This poison deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds. Poisoned creatures can make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} each round to negate the damage and end the affliction.

features.name: Vinetrap
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Vinetrap: Vines choked with thorns, blossoms, leaflets, and other floral debris burst to life on and around the subject of this spell. When this spell is cast, the subject becomes paralyzed and entangled, though a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} negates the paralysis. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} on its turn, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end both the paralysis and entangle effects.
The subject takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} each turn from the sharp thorns. This {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} is considered to be cold iron for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.

features.name: Dispel Magic, Greater
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dispel Magic, Greater: This functions as a targeted dispel magic, but it can dispel multiple spells, starting with the highest level spells and proceeding to lower level spells.

features.name: Changestaff
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Changestaff: This spell changes an ordinary quarterstaff into a treant creature. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.

features.name: Fey Magic
features.desc: At 15th level, you get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) made to overcome a creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}. This bonus stacks with the one from the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g} Penetration and Greater Spell Penetration {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}.

features.name: Summon Nereid
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Nereid: This spell summons to your side a natural nereid. The summoned ally appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.

features.name: Summon Hamadryad
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Hamadryad: This spell summons to your side a natural hamadryad. The summoned ally appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.

features.name: Soul of the Fey
features.desc: At 20th level, your soul becomes one with the world of the fey. You gain immunity to poison and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/cold iron. Once per day, you can cast cloak of dreams as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} using your sorcerer level as your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.

features.name: Sylvan Bloodline
features.desc: Your ties to nature have more to do with creatures than with capriciousness.

features.name: Class Skill — Lore (Nature)
features.desc: Additional class skill from the fey bloodline.

features.name: Woodland Stride
features.desc: At 3rd level, you can move through any sort difficult terrain at your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and without taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} or suffering any other impairment.

The entire area of effect is considered difficult terrain while the effect lasts.

Summon Nereid: This spell summons to your side a natural nereid. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.

features.name: Summon Hamadryad
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Summon Hamadryad: This spell summons to your side a natural hamadryad. The summoned ally appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.

features.name: Soul of the Fey
features.desc: At 20th level, your soul becomes one with the world of the fey. You gain immunity to poison and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/cold iron. Once per day, you can cast cloak of dreams as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} using your sorcerer level as your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.

features.name: Bloodline Arcana
features.desc: Unlike most sorcerers whose innate magic is powered by force of personality, you use pure willpower to master and fuel your magic. You use your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, rather than your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, to determine all class features and effects relating to your sorcerer class, such as bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day, maximum spell level you can cast, and the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of your spells. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.

features.name: Cantrips
features.desc: Sorcerers can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.

features.name: Cantrips
features.desc: Sorcerers can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.

features.name: Bloodline Class Skill Selection
features.desc: You can choose any knowlege {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} to add to your class skills.

features.name: Arcane Bloodline Arcana
features.desc: Whenever you apply a metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} to a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that increases the slot used by at least one level, increase the spell's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by +1. This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} does not stack with itself and does not apply to spells modified by the Heighten Spell feat.

features.name: Bloodline Arcana
features.desc: Unlike most sorcerers, whose innate magic is powered by force of personality, you use your intellect to understand and master your mystic powers. You use your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, rather than your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, to determine all class features and effects relating to your sorcerer class, such as bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day, the maximum spell level you can cast, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of your spells, and the number of daily uses of your bloodline powers. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}.

features.name: Animal Companion
features.desc: Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.

features.name: Sage Sorcerer
features.desc: Your magic comes from the knowledge and traditions that your bloodline accumulated through the generations, not just from force of personality. You use your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, rather than your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, to determine all class features and effects relating to your sorcerer class, such as bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day, the maximum spell level you can cast, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of your spells, and the number of daily uses of your bloodline powers.

features.name: Arcane Bolt
features.desc: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash a bolt of magic force as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This bolt deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.

features.name: Bloodline Arcana
features.desc: Unlike most sorcerers, whose innate magic is powered by force of personality, you use your intellect to understand and master your mystic powers. You use your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, rather than your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, to determine all class features and effects relating to your sorcerer class, such as bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day, the maximum spell level you can cast, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of your spells, and the number of daily uses of your bloodline powers. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}.

features.name: Bloodline Class Skill Selection
features.desc: You can choose any knowlege {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} to add to your class skills.

features.name: Combat Casting Adept
features.desc: Combat Casting Adept: At 3rd level, you get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} made to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or use a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}. At 9th level, your concentration {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} bonus increases to +3, and at 15th level, it increases to +4. At 20th level, this ability is replaced by arcane apotheosis.

features.name: Magic Missile
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Magic Missile: A missile of magical energy darts forth from your fingertip and strikes its target, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 points of force {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
The missile strikes unerringly, even if the target is in melee combat, so long as it has less than total cover or total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}.
For every two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} beyond 1st, you gain an additional missile — two at 3rd level, three at 5th, four at 7th, and the maximum of five missiles at 9th level or higher.

features.name: Invisibility
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Invisibility: The touched creature becomes invisible.
If a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required, an invisible creature has a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. The spell ends if the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} any creature. For the purposes of this spell, an attack includes any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Target}spell targeting{/g} a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}Actions{/g} directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.

features.name: Dispel Magic
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dispel Magic: You can use dispel magic to end one ongoing spell that has been cast on a creature.
You make one dispel {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) and compare that to the spell with highest caster level ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 11 + the spell's caster level). If successful, that spell ends. If not, compare the same result to the spell with the next highest caster level. Repeat this process until you have dispelled one spell affecting the target, or you have failed to dispel every spell.

features.name: Dimension Door
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dimension Door: You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to any other spot within range.

features.name: New Arcana
features.desc: At 9th level, you can add any one {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} from the sorcerer/wizard spell list to your list of spells known. This spell must be of a level that you are capable of casting. You can also add one additional spell at 13th level and 17th level.

features.name: Break Enchantment
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Break Enchantment: This spell frees victims from enchantments, transmutations, and curses. Break enchantment can reverse even an instantaneous effect. For each such effect, you make a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level, maximum +15) against a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 11 + caster level of the effect. Success means that the creature is free of the spell, curse, or effect.

features.name: True Seeing
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
True Seeing: You confer on the subject the ability to see all things as they actually are. The subject sees through normal and magical darkness, notices secret doors hidden by magic, sees the exact locations of creatures or objects under blur or displacement effects, sees invisible creatures or objects normally, sees through illusions, and sees the true form of polymorphed, changed, or transmuted things.

features.name: Banishment
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Banishment: This spell is a more powerful version of the dismissal spell. It enables you to force extraplanar creatures out of your home plane. As many as 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} of creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} can be banished in a 30-foot radius; creatures who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first.
Dismissal: This spell forces an extraplanar creature back to its proper plane if it fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. If the spell is successful, the creature is instantly whisked away.

features.name: School Power
features.desc: At 15th level, pick one {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} you cast from that school increases by +2. This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} stacks with the bonus granted by Spell Focus.

features.name: Power Word Stun
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Power Word Stun: You utter a single word of power that instantly causes one creature of your choice to become stunned, whether the creature can hear the word or not. The duration of the spell depends on the target's current hit point total. Any creature that currently has 151 or more {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} is unaffected by power word stun.

features.name: Clashing Rocks
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Clashing Rocks: You create two Colossal-sized masses of rock, dirt, and stone and slam them together against a single creature between them. The clashing rocks appear up to 30 feet away from the target on opposite sides and rush toward it with a mighty grinding crash. You must make a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit the target with the rocks. The clashing rocks ignore {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} and cover. A creature struck by the clashing rocks takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}20d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} and is knocked prone.
If the clashing rocks miss the target, the target still takes 10d6 points of bludgeoning {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from falling rocks and is knocked prone. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} reduces this damage to half and the target remains standing. Creatures other than the target that occupy the spaces where the clashing rocks appear or within their path must also make Reflex saves or take 10d6 points of bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone (save for half and remain standing).

features.name: Arcane Apotheosis
features.desc: At 20th level, your body surges with arcane power. All your {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} made to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or use a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} are automatic successes.

features.name: Secondary Bloodline
features.desc: A crossblooded sorcerer gains additional bloodline as a secondary bloodline. She receives only {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} from this bloodline.

features.name: Reduced Spellbook
features.desc: A crossblooded sorcerer has one fewer spell known at each level than regular sorcerer.

features.name: Seeker's Trapfinding
features.desc: Seekers often look to ancient devices, old tomes, and strange magical items in order to learn more about their oracle mysteries. As a result of this curiosity and thanks to an innate knack at deciphering the strange and weird, a seeker gains {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. In addition, at 1st level, a seeker adds half his oracle level on Trickery skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} (minimum +1).

features.name: Bloodline
features.desc:
Each sorcerer has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, an additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}, and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family's past. For example, a sorcerer might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the sorcerer gains levels. A sorcerer must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of sorcerer. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
Filled with magical power that screams for release, sorcery is not so much a calling as a blessing — or a curse. For some sorcerers, this arcane birthright manifests in subtle and carefully controlled ways, assisting in their manipulation of others or the pursuit of lofty goals. For others, it is wild and unpredictable, the primal and explosive lashing out of a power greater than themselves.
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional spell, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels. These spells cannot be exchanged for different spells at higher levels.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, a sorcerer receives one bonus feat, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The sorcerer must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.

features.name: Seeker Bonus Feat
features.desc: At 5th, 10th and 15th level, Seeker gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} from the list:

features.name: Bloodline (Nine-Tailed Heir)
features.desc:
A nine tailed heir chooses sorcerer's bloodline as usual, but she will not learn additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} derived from her bloodline.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir receives one bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The nine-tailed heir must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.

features.name: Magical Tail
features.desc: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.

features.name: Magical Tail
features.desc: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.

features.name: Magical Tail
features.desc: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.

features.name: Magical Tail
features.desc: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.

features.name: Magical Tail
features.desc: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.

features.name: Magical Tail
features.desc: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.

features.name: Magical Tail
features.desc: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.

features.name: Magical Tail
features.desc: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.

features.name: Magical Tail
features.desc: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.

features.name: Overwhelming Penetration
features.desc: At 1st level, an overwhelming mage gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome a target's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every 6 levels thereafter.

features.name: Overwhelming Spell
features.desc: At 6th level, an overwhelming mage gains the ability to sacrifice a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slot of 3rd level or higher to increase the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the next spell he casts during the next two {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, equal to one third of the sacrificed spell level.

name: Sorcerer
desc: Sorcerers excel at casting a selection of favored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} frequently, making them powerful battle mages. As they become familiar with a specific and ever-widening set of spells, sorcerers often discover new and versatile ways of making use of magics other spellcasters might overlook. Their bloodlines also grant them additional abilities, assuring that no two sorcerers are ever quite alike.

archetypes.name: Empyreal Sorcerer
archetypes.desc: Your heavenly power derives from insight rather than force of personality.

archetypes.name: Sylvan Sorcerer
archetypes.desc: Your ties to nature have more to do with creatures than with capriciousness.

archetypes.name: Sage Sorcerer
archetypes.desc: Your magic comes from the knowledge and traditions that your bloodline accumulated through the generations, not just from force of personality. You use your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, rather than your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, to determine all class features and effects relating to your sorcerer class, such as bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day, the maximum spell level you can cast, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of your spells, and the number of daily uses of your bloodline powers.

archetypes.name: Crossblooded
archetypes.desc: A crossblooded bloodline combines the powers of two distinct heritages. In most cases, sorcerers with this bloodline are the offspring of two sorcerers from different ancestries, but occasionally a crossblooded sorcerer arises from the conjunction of other powers. A draconic sorcerer who is also the culmination of a great destiny, an abyssal sorcerer from a family that dealt with devils, and an arcane sorcerer raised from birth by fey are all possible sources for crossblooded bloodlines.

archetypes.name: Seeker
archetypes.desc: Sorcerers gain their magical powers through strange and mysterious ways. While most might be content with their strange powers, some adventure far and wide in search of a greater understanding of the genesis and history of their eldritch talents. These {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} are known as seekers, after their obsession with researching ancient texts and obscure ruins for any clues they can find about their heritage and histories.

archetypes.name: Nine Tailed Heir
archetypes.desc: Stories often tell of kitsune with multiple tails, but not many realize that fewer than one kitsune in every thousand has this potential, and those that do usually have a magical quirk in their blood or have been blessed by their {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g}'s deific matron. As a result, most that harness the mystic powers of their newfound tails often gain sorcerous powers, becoming nine-tailed heirs.

archetypes.name: Overwhelming Mage
archetypes.desc: Innate magical powers are always a tempting phenomenon, and many people are content with the extent of their powers, but overwhelming mages strive to improve the sheer capacity of their powers.
